intro: Weberbauera lechleri, commonly known as the rubber tree, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which has been historically used for making rubber. Its growth habit includes a tall, slender trunk with a dense canopy of foliage. The botanical features of Weberbauera lechleri make it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
